question: What is overfitting in machine learning?

options.A: When the model performs well on training data but poorly on new data
options.B: When the model performs well on new data but poorly on training data
options.D: When the model performs poorly on both training and new data

options.B: To estimate the performance on unseen data
options.C: To improve the performance on training data
options.D: To reduce the size of the training data

options.C: It converges faster than batch gradient descent
